{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "TikTok Social Media Manager",
  "description": "Pulse is Africa&#39;s ultimate media playground, serving up the freshest news, entertainment, and lifestyle vibes to young audiences across the continent. We live for creativity, killer storytelling and making a real impact. Catch us bringing the heat on our news platforms, social channels and rocking marketing and production in Nigeria, Ghana, Kenya and Uganda.

We have over 100 million users and more than 100 million video views on our own channels every single month. We are your go-to partner, flexing our massive media muscle and dropping 360-degree in-house marketing solutions to get you noticed. Join us and let&#39;s make some magic!.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: TikTok Social Media Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	The role focuses on creating engaging video and written content for Pulse Nigeria&#39;s social media platforms. It involves managing community interactions, tracking performance metrics, and optimizing content strategy.
	The position requires trend monitoring, campaign execution, and collaboration across internal teams.
	Ultimately, it aims to grow brand visibility, audience engagement, and support overall business goals


Job Responsibilities


	Develop high-quality video content for Pulse Nigeria&#39;s social media platforms.
	Create engaging captions, headlines, and descriptions that drive audience interaction.
	Conduct research to stay up-to-date on industry trends and topics.
	Create video content that resonate to the Pulse Nigeria audience to maximize engagement and reach
	Monitor interactions on the Pulse Nigeria page to create timely content in a professional manner
	Track and analyze engagement metrics (e.g., likes, comments, shares, etc.) to measure content performance.
	Provide regular reporting on content and social media performance.
	Use data to inform future content and social media strategies.
	Become an advocate for the Company in social media spaces, engaging in dialogues and answering questions where appropriate.
	Demonstrate ability to map out marketing strategies and then drive that strategy proven by testing and metrics.
	Monitor trends in social media tools, applications, channels, design and strategy.
	Collaborate with other teams: Editorial, Video, and Sales teams to achieve company wide goals.
	Manage Social Media campaigns and day-to-day activities in line with KPIs including:
	Content Creation: Brainstorm, shoot, edit, and publish TikTok videos that are fun, engaging, and on-brand.
	Identify threats and opportunities in user generated content surrounding the business - Report notable threats to appropriate management.
	Analyze campaigns and translate anecdotal or qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising the social media campaigns.
	Monitor effective benchmarks (best practices) for measuring the impact of social media campaigns. Analyze, review and report on effectiveness of campaigns in an effort to maximise results.
	Trend Spotting: Monitor TikTok trends, challenges, sounds, and hashtags to keep our content fresh and relevant.
	Community Engagement: Reply to comments, engage with other creators, and participate in TikTok conversations to grow our presence.
	Performance Tracking: Monitor video performance using TikTok analytics and provide simple reports with insights and recommendations.
	Collaboration: Work closely with the social media and creative teams to align TikTok content with overall campaigns and brand goals.
	Experimentation: Test new content formats, posting times, and styles to find what works best for our audience.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Communications, Public Relations, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in social media management.
	Understanding of Social Media Strategy
	Content editing, and basic knowledge of design tools (e.g., Canva, Capcut)
	Understanding of major social media platforms (e.g, Instagram, TikTok)
	Communication Skills
	Analytical Skills
	Familiarity with social media management tools (e.g., Buffer, Sprout Social).


What We Offer


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-13",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Pulse Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185908"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



TikTok Social Media Manager Job at Pulse Nigeria




        
    

        
        Pulse is Africa's ultimate media playground, serving up the freshest news, entertainment, and lifestyle vibes to young audiences across the continent. We live for creativity, killer storytelling and making a real impact. Catch us bringing the heat on our news platforms, social channels and rocking marketing and production in Nigeria, Ghana, Kenya and Uganda.

We have over 100 million users and more than 100 million video views on our own channels every single month. We are your go-to partner, flexing our massive media muscle and dropping 360-degree in-house marketing solutions to get you noticed. Join us and let's make some magic!.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: TikTok Social Media Manager
Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	The role focuses on creating engaging video and written content for Pulse Nigeria's social media platforms. It involves managing community interactions, tracking performance metrics, and optimizing content strategy.
	The position requires trend monitoring, campaign execution, and collaboration across internal teams.
	Ultimately, it aims to grow brand visibility, audience engagement, and support overall business goals


Job Responsibilities


	Develop high-quality video content for Pulse Nigeria's social media platforms.
	Create engaging captions, headlines, and descriptions that drive audience interaction.
	Conduct research to stay up-to-date on industry trends and topics.
	Create video content that resonate to the Pulse Nigeria audience to maximize engagement and reach
	Monitor interactions on the Pulse Nigeria page to create timely content in a professional manner
	Track and analyze engagement metrics (e.g., likes, comments, shares, etc.) to measure content performance.
	Provide regular reporting on content and social media performance.
	Use data to inform future content and social media strategies.
	Become an advocate for the Company in social media spaces, engaging in dialogues and answering questions where appropriate.
	Demonstrate ability to map out marketing strategies and then drive that strategy proven by testing and metrics.
	Monitor trends in social media tools, applications, channels, design and strategy.
	Collaborate with other teams: Editorial, Video, and Sales teams to achieve company wide goals.
	Manage Social Media campaigns and day-to-day activities in line with KPIs including:
	Content Creation: Brainstorm, shoot, edit, and publish TikTok videos that are fun, engaging, and on-brand.
	Identify threats and opportunities in user generated content surrounding the business - Report notable threats to appropriate management.
	Analyze campaigns and translate anecdotal or qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising the social media campaigns.
	Monitor effective benchmarks (best practices) for measuring the impact of social media campaigns. Analyze, review and report on effectiveness of campaigns in an effort to maximise results.
	Trend Spotting: Monitor TikTok trends, challenges, sounds, and hashtags to keep our content fresh and relevant.
	Community Engagement: Reply to comments, engage with other creators, and participate in TikTok conversations to grow our presence.
	Performance Tracking: Monitor video performance using TikTok analytics and provide simple reports with insights and recommendations.
	Collaboration: Work closely with the social media and creative teams to align TikTok content with overall campaigns and brand goals.
	Experimentation: Test new content formats, posting times, and styles to find what works best for our audience.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in social media management.
	Understanding of Social Media Strategy
	Content editing, and basic knowledge of design tools (e.g., Canva, Capcut)
	Understanding of major social media platforms (e.g, Instagram, TikTok)
	Communication Skills
	Analytical Skills
	Familiarity with social media management tools (e.g., Buffer, Sprout Social).


What We Offer


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Office Secretary / Administrative Officer",
  "description": "De-Net Optimum Communication Limited is a renowned and independently recognized Internet Service Provider in Nigeria. We are committed to delivering efficient and reliable internet infrastructure solutions to organizations and corporate individuals across the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Secretary / Administrative Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Asaba - Delta / Port Harcourt - Rivers / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Office Secretary / Administrative Officer to support our daily operations and ensure smooth office administration in Lagos, Port Harcourt, and Asaba.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage office correspondence, emails, phone calls, and official documents.
	Maintain and organize files, records, and office databases.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Ensure the office environment is well-maintained and conducive for work.
	Support other departments with administrative tasks when necessary.
	Prepare reports, memos, and presentations as required.
	Assist in office procurement, inventory management, and vendor coordination.
	Handle confidential information with professionalism and discretion.


Requirements


	B.Sc/HND in Office Administration, Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or a related field.
	5-10 years of proven experience in office administration or secretarial roles.
	Strong organizational, multitasking, and time-management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and handle sensitive information.
	Professional appearance and demeanor.


Salary
N50,000 - N80,000 Monthly with performance-related benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@de-net.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Office Secretary / Administrative Officer Job at De-Net Optimum Communication Limited




        
    

        
        De-Net Optimum Communication Limited is a renowned and independently recognized Internet Service Provider in Nigeria. We are committed to delivering efficient and reliable internet infrastructure solutions to organizations and corporate individuals across the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Secretary / Administrative Officer

Job Location: Asaba - Delta / Port Harcourt - Rivers / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Office Secretary / Administrative Officer to support our daily operations and ensure smooth office administration in Lagos, Port Harcourt, and Asaba.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage office correspondence, emails, phone calls, and official documents.
	Maintain and organize files, records, and office databases.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Ensure the office environment is well-maintained and conducive for work.
	Support other departments with administrative tasks when necessary.
	Prepare reports, memos, and presentations as required.
	Assist in office procurement, inventory management, and vendor coordination.
	Handle confidential information with professionalism and discretion.


Requirements


	B.Sc/HND in Office Administration, Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or a related field.
	5-10 years of proven experience in office administration or secretarial roles.
	Strong organizational, multitasking, and time-management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and handle sensitive information.
	Professional appearance and demeanor.


Salary
N50,000 - N80,000 Monthly with performance-related benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@de-net.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

We dare say that, Vestates was ahead of its time in that regard.

The corona virus pandemic (COVID-19) has indirectly exposed how dependent the world is on technology, to transmit information among other things; same importance is applicable to our business and cannot be overstated. Technology has now been brought back to our focus, thereby sponsoring seamless growth in our operations scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Entry Clerk
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Part-time
Work Schedule: Ideally, 2 days per week or as needed
Employment Type: Part-Time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Part-Time Data Entry Clerk to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for accurately entering, updating, and managing real estate data collected by our sales team.
	This role is critical in ensuring the integrity and accessibility of our property and client information.
	The Data Entry Clerk will work two days per week and may be assigned additional administrative or data-related tasks as needed.


Key Responsibilities


	Accurately input property listings, client information, transaction details, and other data collected by the sales team into the company&rsquo;s CRM and internal databases.
	Verify and cross-check data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness before entry.
	Maintain confidentiality and security of sensitive client and property information.
	Organize and manage digital files and records in a structured and accessible manner.
	Respond promptly to data requests from team members and management.
	Assist in data cleanup, audits, and migration projects when required.
	Perform other administrative or data-related duties as assigned by the supervisor or management.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, IT, or related field is a plus).

	Proven experience in data entry, preferably in GIS and Remote Sensing, sales, or administrative roles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and data management tools.
	Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Ability to work independently and manage time effectively with minimal supervision.
	Excellent organizational skills and ability to handle repetitive tasks with consistency.
	Reliable internet connection and access to a computer.
	Availability to work two fixed days per week (specific days to be confirmed during hiring).


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with property management, Microsoft Office, retail software, or GIS and remote sensing.

Data Entry Clerk Job at Vestates




        
    

        
        Vestates was born on the 19th March 2013 as a private Limited Liability company, to launch out into the real estate and property management services space. Our aim over the years has been to provide complete real estate services. These include the sale and lease of residential and commercial properties, and long-term property management within Nigeria and Internationally.

From our early days of operation, we have focused on using technology to compete and create a niche for ourselves in the Nigerian real estate industry. Unfortunately, we had to step down to a more analogue approach if we were to work with other stakeholders in the real estate space in Nigeria. We dare say that, Vestates was ahead of its time in that regard.
     

            
    



Over time we have grown to possess a large network of clients, nationally and internationally, including work methods with a stable structure, enforced by a highly skilled and upright team. The corona virus pandemic (COVID-19) has indirectly exposed how dependent the world is on technology, to transmit information among other things; same importance is applicable to our business and cannot be overstated. Technology has now been brought back to our focus, thereby sponsoring seamless growth in our operations scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Entry Clerk
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Part-time
Work Schedule: Ideally, 2 days per week or as needed
Employment Type: Part-Time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Part-Time Data Entry Clerk to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for accurately entering, updating, and managing real estate data collected by our sales team.
	This role is critical in ensuring the integrity and accessibility of our property and client information.
	The Data Entry Clerk will work two days per week and may be assigned additional administrative or data-related tasks as needed.


Key Responsibilities


	Accurately input property listings, client information, transaction details, and other data collected by the sales team into the company’s CRM and internal databases.
	Verify and cross-check data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness before entry.
	Maintain confidentiality and security of sensitive client and property information.
	Organize and manage digital files and records in a structured and accessible manner.
	Respond promptly to data requests from team members and management.
	Assist in data cleanup, audits, and migration projects when required.
	Perform other administrative or data-related duties as assigned by the supervisor or management.
	Collaborate with the sales and operations teams to ensure data alignment and support business objectives.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, or related field is a plus).
	1 to 2 years of experience
	Proven experience in data entry, preferably in GIS and Remote Sensing, sales, or administrative roles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and data management tools.
	Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Ability to work independently and manage time effectively with minimal supervision.
	Excellent organizational skills and ability to handle repetitive tasks with consistency.
	Reliable internet connection and access to a computer.
	Availability to work two fixed days per week (specific days to be confirmed during hiring).


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with property management, Microsoft Office, retail software, or GIS and remote sensing.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Executive - Outstations",
  "description": "The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria).&nbsp;We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Procurement Executive - Outstations

Job Locations:&nbsp;North, West &amp; South, Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are a leading QSR in the Hospitality sector seeking a Procurement Executive to manage sourcing activities at our outstations.
	The Executive would visit major markets, Farms and supplier locations to find reliable vendors, negotiate prices, and ensure items are bought on time and at good cost.
	The role also involves using ERP tools for processing purchase orders and request, requires regular travel to Identify new vendors, monitoring of vendor performance and consistent research/market survey to stay updated on price changes.


Key Responsibilities


	Research and identify Farm Produce/items that are cheaper to buy in outstation regions or more cost-effective to bring in from other regions
	Research and identify markets and supplier hubs within your outstation to find quality vendors for all food and non-food items.
	Vet and register new vendors and distributors, ensuring proper documentation and compliance with company policy.
	Process daily outstation Purchase Request and Purchase Orders using the ERP system (e.g., Microsoft Dynamics 365).
	Monitor market trends and price changes regularly and share insights with the Procurement Manager.
	Keep proper records of all purchases and coordinate with warehouse, inventory, and finance teams for smooth procurement operations.


Qualifications


	Degree/Diploma in Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Admin, or related field.
	3&ndash;4 years of relevant experience, preferably in QSR, hospitality, or FMCG.
	Field experience with vendors in local and rural markets.
	ERP knowledge (esp. Microsoft Dynamics 365) and strong negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in Excel and Word for reporting.
	Willingness to travel often and work independently.
	Hausa or Yoruba fluency is a plus, depending on the region.


Note


	Candidates who do not meet the above criteria need not apply.&nbsp;
	If you meet the above criteria, please send your Curriculum Vitae not later than 2 Weeks from the date of this publication.

Procurement Executive - Outstations Job at the Place




        
    

        
        The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria). We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Executive - Outstations
     

            
    



Job Locations: North, West & South, Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are a leading QSR in the Hospitality sector seeking a Procurement Executive to manage sourcing activities at our outstations.
	The Executive would visit major markets, Farms and supplier locations to find reliable vendors, negotiate prices, and ensure items are bought on time and at good cost.
	The role also involves using ERP tools for processing purchase orders and request, requires regular travel to Identify new vendors, monitoring of vendor performance and consistent research/market survey to stay updated on price changes.


Key Responsibilities


	Research and identify Farm Produce/items that are cheaper to buy in outstation regions or more cost-effective to bring in from other regions
	Research and identify markets and supplier hubs within your outstation to find quality vendors for all food and non-food items.
	Vet and register new vendors and distributors, ensuring proper documentation and compliance with company policy.
	Process daily outstation Purchase Request and Purchase Orders using the ERP system (e.g., Microsoft Dynamics 365).
	Monitor market trends and price changes regularly and share insights with the Procurement Manager.
	Keep proper records of all purchases and coordinate with warehouse, inventory, and finance teams for smooth procurement operations.


Qualifications


	Degree/Diploma in Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Admin, or related field.
	3–4 years of relevant experience, preferably in QSR, hospitality, or FMCG.
	Field experience with vendors in local and rural markets.
	ERP knowledge (esp. Microsoft Dynamics 365) and strong negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in Excel and Word for reporting.
	Willingness to travel often and work independently.
	Hausa or Yoruba fluency is a plus, depending on the region.


Note


	Candidates who do not meet the above criteria need not apply. 
	If you meet the above criteria, please send your Curriculum Vitae not later than 2 Weeks from the date of this publication.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited - Our client is a highly diversified group and currently has its office at Ogba in Lagos. They currently run a fully accredited Polytechnic.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogba, Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Towards enhancing operational performances, Our client urgently desires the services of a&nbsp;Receptionist with a minimum of 5 years&rsquo; experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet all students, staff and visitors in a polite, friendly, professional manner.
	Co-ordinate safe entrance and exits of all students, staff and visitors, at all entrance doors ensuring they are signed in and out and that no&nbsp;unauthorized person gains access.
	Deal with enquiries relating to matters connected with the day to day running of the Institution , including liaising with every departments
	Use the telephone to make/check transport and other arrangements as&nbsp;required.
	Interact with students with learning difficulties/disabilities sensitively and&nbsp;flexibly.
	Maintain information in a confidential manner.
	Maintain an up to date record of escort and transport contact details.
	To handle office diaries.
	To liaise with other Heads of Learning Centre as necessary.

Receptionist Job at Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Brilliant Performance Solutions Limited - Our client is a highly diversified group and currently has its office at Ogba in Lagos. They currently run a fully accredited Polytechnic.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist
Job Location: Ogba, Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Towards enhancing operational performances, Our client urgently desires the services of a Receptionist with a minimum of 5 years’ experience.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Greet all students, staff and visitors in a polite, friendly, professional manner.
	Co-ordinate safe entrance and exits of all students, staff and visitors, at all entrance doors ensuring they are signed in and out and that no unauthorized person gains access.
	Deal with enquiries relating to matters connected with the day to day running of the Institution , including liaising with every departments
	Use the telephone to make/check transport and other arrangements as required.
	Interact with students with learning difficulties/disabilities sensitively and flexibly.
	Maintain information in a confidential manner.
	Maintain an up to date record of escort and transport contact details.
	To handle office diaries.
	To liaise with other Heads of Learning Centre as necessary.
	To monitor general stock levels and stationery.
	Use and input Student information onto the Polytechnic MIS.
	Sign for, check and distribute deliveries/post.
	Support the administrative team with general administrative duties as directed by the Head of Learning Centre, e.g. minute meetings, petty cash forms, letters.
	To carry out all duties in accordance School policies.
	To attend any mandatory training as requested
	To carry out other such similar duties that may be reasonably required by the Head of Learning Centre, or by the Principal/Senior Leadership Team.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with at least 5 years of experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bphotjobs@gmail.com or: jobmasters2020@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates who reside in any area close to Berger, Ogba areas close to Ogba in Lagos will have an advantage.
